item.title: Detecting Non-breaking Space in R
item.description: Last night while I was cleaning data in R, I encountered such a weird behavior of unique() function that I once suspected that there had been something wrong with the newly updated R 3.4.3. The following is a reproducible example of my problem. I read in a vector variable x from csv file, and printed it on R console. x ## [1] "non-breaking space" "non-breakingÂ space" Apparently, x contained two “identtical” elements and it should have only one unique value.
